title: Millennial heaven: Super8 debuts shared room concept, decked with foosball table, cornhole
text:
CLOSE There are a few things that you can take with you on any hotel stay to make it feel a little more like you're at home. Michael Roorda, Reviewed.com

If you're looking for a more modern hotel experience – or one that might remind you more of a college dorm or hostel – Super8 has a new concept for you.

The company is debuting its first shared room design, ROOM8, created by Candice Buttars, an undergraduate design student at Utah State University, selected as the winner of Super8's ROOM8 Design Challenge. Celebrity interior designer and TV personality Alison Victoria assisted Buttars.

Here are the amenities you can expect in the room:

Entertainment like vintage arcade games; 65-inch TV; foosball table; and cornhole boards

Open dining layout with apartment-sized refrigerator and microwave

Separate sleeping spaces with beds for as many as four guests

USB ports, wireless charging spots and power outlets all over the room

Retro video games are a highlight of Super 8 by Wyndham’s new shared room concept, ROOM8. (Photo: PRNewsfoto/Wyndham Hotels & Resorts)

"More and more, we're seeing groups of guests who want space to stretch out and relax, but without the sacrifice of giving up their own private sleeping space," Mike Mueller, Super 8 brand president, said in a statement. "Whether it's a group of millennials, a young family or an on-the-road construction crew, ROOM8 delivers the perfect balance of privacy and community," he added.

Super8, part of Wyndham Hotels & Resorts, will pilot the room as early as 2020. The brand is currently going through a redesign across its hotels in the U.S. and Canada.
